4686bb53-75de-4d77-bebf-6a7273bc363e.description: The International Baccalaureate Organization has recognized DePaul University’s program of study entitled “Teaching and Learning in a Global Context” as meeting all the academic requirements of the IB certificate in teaching and learning in the Middle Years Programme (grades 6-10) and the Diploma Programme (grades 11 and 12). Current teachers will complete four fully online courses. This badge represents the completion of the Teaching and Learning in a Global Context for the DP.
4686bb53-75de-4d77-bebf-6a7273bc363e.name: Teaching and Learning in a Global Context for the Diploma Programme

ef93e233-8df9-497e-8092-45c9433a78fb.description: The Catholic Educator Social Emotional Micro-credential provides Catholic educators with a competency-based learning experience that focuses on developing an individual’s self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship skills and responsible decision-making skills within a context of Catholic culture and faith. Catholic educators will assess and evaluate their current skills and competencies within the context their personal and professional roles in education.
ef93e233-8df9-497e-8092-45c9433a78fb.name: Catholic Social Emotional Champion

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete micro-credential benchmark assignments. These benchmarks include presented summaries of assessments of student work and the administration of a student survey and the complete the teacher/principal survey as the participant in this micro-credential course.

882b6d1b-e188-4f67-bd3d-1a7358df9b1f.description: The earner of this badge has completed a series of four professional development courses designed to establish a school-wide Lesson Study to improve mathematics teaching and learning through teacher collaboration. Lesson Study is a structured process for schools and teachers to work together to come up solutions to overcome challenges in order to improve teaching and learning.
882b6d1b-e188-4f67-bd3d-1a7358df9b1f.name: Lesson Study Micro-credential - Teaching Mathematics Through Problem Solving

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Engage in all  course activities and assignments and complete one lesson study cycle using Collaborative Lesson Research (CLR).

Courses are taught by the program leader, Akihiko Takahashi, associate professor of mathematics education of DePaul University. He also serves the president of the board of Lesson Study Alliance and a member of the executive committee of the World Association of Lesson Studies.

25189274-743f-4d7a-8f8c-bd300681419e.description: This Social Emotional Micro-credential course provides participants with a competency-based learning experience that focuses on developing an individual’s self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship skills, and responsible decision-making skills. Throughout the course, participants will assess and evaluate their current skills and competencies within the context of their personal and professional roles in education.
25189274-743f-4d7a-8f8c-bd300681419e.name: Social Emotional Learning Micro-credential Program

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: There are six concise modules within this micro-credential. To earn the micro-credential digital badge, you will need to complete modules and provide the artifacts that will add to your digital portfolio.

96b8e9d9-59c7-46b2-873a-f13b0cb04cdb.description: The Catholic Identity: Awareness micro-credential badge is awarded to participants that engage their students in inquiry driven, project based learning experiences that explore the following essential questions: What does justice look like? What do you believe about justice? This is first badge in Catholic Identity: Justice micro-credential program created in 2020 through a partnership of the Archdiocese of Chicago and the College of Education at DePaul University.
96b8e9d9-59c7-46b2-873a-f13b0cb04cdb.name: Catholic Identity: Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete micro-credential benchmark assignments. These benchmarks include presented summaries of assessments of student work and the administration of a student survey and the complete the teacher/principal survey as the participant in this micro-credential course.

869cde23-f687-41ec-8a1e-94eb56a828c0.description: This badge is awarded to participants that engage students in inquiry driven, project based learning experiences that explore the following essential question: Why is there injustice? In this unit students will encounter others, identify injustices, and select a focus for their Justice Genius Hours. This is second badge in Catholic Identity: Justice micro-credential program created in 2020 through a partnership of the Archdiocese of Chicago and the College of Education at DePaul University.
869cde23-f687-41ec-8a1e-94eb56a828c0.name: Catholic Identity: Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete micro-credential benchmark assignments. These benchmarks include presented summaries of assessments of student work and the administration of a student survey and the complete the teacher/principal survey as the participant in this micro-credential course.

b80bc560-18a7-44d6-ac37-e9d5ade8afc4.description: Catholic schools are deeply dedicated to advancing the work of the Church through mission driven education. The goal of this micro-credential online learning experience is to publicly and visibly highlight the distinct, values-based achievements of Catholic school students. Catholic values and Gospel mission raise the value of Catholic education as unique in comparison with other public and private school entities.
b80bc560-18a7-44d6-ac37-e9d5ade8afc4.name: Catholic Identity: Justice

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Catholic Identity: Action
Catholic Identity: Analysis
Catholic Identity: Awareness
Catholic Identity: Prayer and Reflection

ba4de829-04d8-4588-9775-e402ff313ff4.description: This badge is awarded to participants that engage students in inquiry driven, project based learning experiences that explore the following essential question: How can we explore the depths of God's call to seek justice and pursue peace? In this unit, students explore the power and methods of prayer, incorporating the element of prayer into their Justice Genius Hour efforts. Students will complete their Justice Genius Hour projects and present and share them.
ba4de829-04d8-4588-9775-e402ff313ff4.name: Catholic Identity: Prayer and Reflection

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete micro-credential benchmark assignments. These benchmarks include presented summaries of assessments of student work and the administration of a student survey and the complete the teacher/principal survey as the participant in this micro-credential course.

671ec984-d950-4511-8183-0317eb576e5f.description: Participants completed the year-long Empathy Driven Teaching micro-credential through the Office of Innovative Professional Learning at DePaul University.
671ec984-d950-4511-8183-0317eb576e5f.name: Empathy Driven Teaching

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants completed the year-long Empathy Driven Teaching micro-credential through the Office of Innovative Professional Learning at DePaul University.

c79b1f02-6e1d-4b5e-b700-c5cae9a5c6f9.description: The Catholic Identity: Action micro-credential badge is awarded to participants that engage their students in inquiry driven, project based learning experiences that explore the following essential question: How can you be a catalyst of justice for your brothers and sisters in Christ? In this unit, students propose solutions to the injustices they identified, outlining their response as their Justice Genius Hour projects.
c79b1f02-6e1d-4b5e-b700-c5cae9a5c6f9.name: Catholic Identity: Action

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must complete micro-credential benchmark assignments. These benchmarks include presented summaries of assessments of student work and the administration of a student survey and the complete the teacher/principal survey as the participant in this micro-credential course.

cea1da24-38ee-44c5-9a5d-58c32090b6a0.description: he content of the course that leads to this certificate shapes pre-service, new, and experienced educators into reflective practitioners and teacher-researchers ready for teaching within an IB PYP Programme. The IBEC PYP consists of four key modules/courses that are research-based and which place emphasis on knowledge of the IB literature and ongoing research. This program focuses on developing practical knowledge of how the IB programmes are designed, interpreted, and implemented.
cea1da24-38ee-44c5-9a5d-58c32090b6a0.name: Teaching and Learning in a Global Context for the Primary Years Programme

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrating an understanding of the IB’s programme curriculum frameworks and the processes that underpin them is an integral part of the knowledge that an IB teacher should possess. The program provides learners with an in-depth examination of the Primary Years Programme curriculum framework, processes of teaching and learning, methods of assessment, and the keys to implementing teaching within a global context.

skills.name: Assessment In The International Baccalaureate Programs
Teaching And Learning In The International Baccalaureate Programs

103f1ba5-cc23-49e3-a2b5-af1562201319.description: The Algebra Project Micro-Credential (APMC) is a two part course created by the Algebra Project Staff and Broward College faculty. The Algebra Project is collaborating with middle and high school teachers and students in Broward County Public Schools to co-create a classroom culture that fosters meaningful interpretations of mathematics. This badge represents completion of Algebra Project Micro-Credential 1.0: A study of Radical Equations (Mose and Cobb), Height Chart and Trip Line.
103f1ba5-cc23-49e3-a2b5-af1562201319.name: Algebra Project Micro-Credential 1.0

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Students will first explore some content modules and use the 5 step curriculum process to explore the mathematics in the modules. Curriculum (What we teach?) Instruction (How we teach?) Assessment (How we assess?) Culture (How do we create productive and safe classroom environments?)

8b67ac18-a6c7-4a3b-9180-3a117f4c78b2.description: The inSTEM micro-credential is a three part course created by the inSTEM Staff which is part of the DePaul University College of Education and the College of Health and Science. inSTEM staff has successfully offered at least 8 years of inSTEM programming to middle and high school students. Each part of the course is designed to provide educators with opportunities to rethink traditional teaching practices and build STEM competency through experiential learning including coding and STEM projects.
8b67ac18-a6c7-4a3b-9180-3a117f4c78b2.name: inSTEM Teacher Professional Development

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: inSTEM's learning environment is built around a love of learning, collaborating with peers and mentors, and bringing the participants' creativity to life. Our programs combine Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics using problem-based learning. In addition, inSTEM involves mentorship and female empowerment by nurturing and encouraging girls (especially those in underrepresented populations) to learn about STEM areas as an option for high school, college, and professional studies.

ed7c0df8-450b-48d9-8d61-711b6f797404.description: The Faith Leadership micro-credential provides leaders and emerging leaders with competency based learning and leadership coaching that is personalized to help leaders enhance their leadership success. Throughout the micro-credential experience leaders gain a stronger sense of agency – to understand their own faith, emotional competencies, and the broader range of experiences and paths they can create to achieve deeper faith and connections to leadership.
ed7c0df8-450b-48d9-8d61-711b6f797404.name: Faith Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Foundations of Faith Leadership Success
Heart and Spirit of the Leader
Building a Successful Team
Creating and Fostering Change
Imprinting your Faith Leadership
Leading Transformation
Celebrating Leadership Success and Continuing Momentum

88ebfb3f-66f0-416f-9ee1-a747dddad7c9.description: International Baccalaureate has recognized DePaul University’s program of study entitled “Leadership Practice: Leadership Theory and Practice” as meeting all the academic requirements of the IB certificate in the Leadership Practice. Program participants complete four fully online courses. Within this course, students will learn philosophy and mission; strategic planning; policy development; organizational structures and roles; culture and ethos; and resourcing and infrastructure.
88ebfb3f-66f0-416f-9ee1-a747dddad7c9.name: International Baccalaureate Educator Certificate in Leadership Practice: Leadership Theory and Practice

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: The IB certificate in leadership practice is designed for educators and administrators who want to improve their leadership capabilities in an IB context. Participants develop and refine their capacity to play a role in guiding a school through IB authorization.

496f728f-1208-4e92-9296-bb4bfa3585b6.description: The RISE TPS Micro-credential Program created by DePaul University and the Barat through a grant from the Library of Congress Teaching with Primary Sources program offers a 5-step method to transform teaching and learning with equity and empathy. The question addressed by the RISE TPS Micro-credential is: What can we learn from history’s primary sources to create equity, inclusion, and transformative change in teaching and learning and in the lives of our students?
496f728f-1208-4e92-9296-bb4bfa3585b6.name: RISE Racial Equity in Teaching

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: R.I.S.E Racial Equity in Teaching

5002b316-ad08-4c88-9811-d6fe6bcf206b.description: Learn about 4 major characters (skill sub-sets) in your mind as a way to understand neuroanatomy and how to best use the power of your whole mind.
5002b316-ad08-4c88-9811-d6fe6bcf206b.name: Whole Brain Living Advanced Certification

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Apply neuroscience of Whole Brain Living to support personal growth.
Integrate the BRAIN Huddle in practice.
Coach others to use Whole Brain Living for daily life.
Intervene to support others in applying Whole Brain Living.

f9d1def2-0d69-420a-894d-c5603703cfc7.description: The earner of this badge has completed teacher professional development in the areas of curriculum development, best practices in instruction and assessment, and innovative teaching. The earner is able to apply innovative teaching practices to support student wellness and learning. They can identify best practices to support student learning and analyze student learning to support quality instruction.
f9d1def2-0d69-420a-894d-c5603703cfc7.name: Catholic Innovative Teaching Micro-credential

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete necessary coursework and assessments as part of a microcredential program.

61958b56-af87-4bfb-bd26-abff38b092e4.description: The earner of this badge has completed teacher professional development in the area of remote learning. This person knows how to navigate teacher and student stress, get student attention when teaching remotely, keep students engaged and empower students when teaching remotely.
61958b56-af87-4bfb-bd26-abff38b092e4.name: Innovative Remote Teaching Practices with Civics

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: View all 4 webinar recordings
Write a 200-word essay detailing how the information and strategies can be employed in the classroom.

26229a5a-128d-4e72-b0e4-75b4173000e0.description: The earner of this badge has completed a series of four professional development courses designed to establish a school-wide Lesson Study to improve mathematics teaching and learning through teacher collaboration. Lesson Study is a structured process for schools and teachers to work together to come up solutions to overcome challenges in order to improve teaching and learning.
26229a5a-128d-4e72-b0e4-75b4173000e0.name: Lesson Study Micro-credential

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Engage in all  course activities and assignments and complete one lesson study cycle using Collaborative Lesson Research (CLR).

Courses are taught by the program leader, Akihiko Takahashi, associate professor of mathematics education of DePaul University. He also serves the president of the board of Lesson Study Alliance and a member of the executive committee of the World Association of Lesson Studies.

1020e031-265e-45b5-89eb-2bda7d657fa1.description: The earner of this badge is able to leverage leadership and train or coach other teachers in the skills needed to teach with primary sources, integrate civics and design curriculum. This teacher can inspire their colleagues with a passion for teaching civics using inquiry and primary sources.
1020e031-265e-45b5-89eb-2bda7d657fa1.name: TPS Civics Coaching Expert

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the third course in the TPS Civics Micro-credential program, including all course assignments.

The Barat Education Foundation and DePaul University are grateful to the Library of Congress and the TPS partners who provided resources and guidance in the development of the micro-credential program.

624a69e3-801d-403e-bab9-feff0f0b12fc.description: The earner of this badge is able to incorporate resources from the Library of Congress into teaching. Specifically, this earner recognizes the importance, value, and impact of using primary sources for civic learning. This earner can use the Library’s Primary Source Analysis Tool with a variety of types of primary sources within a civics context.
624a69e3-801d-403e-bab9-feff0f0b12fc.name: TPS Civics Teaching Expert

issuer.summary: issued by DePaul University College of Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete TPS Civics Teaching Expert and all course assignments.

The Barat Education Foundation and DePaul University are grateful to the Library of Congress and the TPS partners who provided resources and guidance in the development of the micro-credential program.
